Section.Catchline: Territory specified for inclusion in one district that is entirely surrounded by other districts.

SectionBody.Text: Any portion of the state which is stated in this joint resolution as being included in one district and which is entirely surrounded by another district shall be included within the surrounding district. Any portion of the state which is stated in this joint resolution as being included in one district and which is entirely surrounded by two or more other districts shall be included within the contiguous district that contains the least population per legislator according to the United States Decennial Census of 2000; however, if the contiguous districts have equal populations, such portion shall be included within that contiguous district that has the lowest number designation.

Note.Text: Superseded by s. 10.15, created by s. 5, Committee Substitute for Senate Joint Resolution 1176, 2012 Regular Session.
